posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: My team has wired cancoders to a robot to attempt to get a swerve drive working, one of the cancoders can’t be found on the phoenix tuner though and i can’t figure out why, everything is wired correctly, i double and triple checked, and can devices wired after the cancoder are found, but it just isn’t appearing

posts.name: Scott McRoberts
posts.cooked: What color are the LEDs blinking?

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: it blinks red but it does turn green near the magnet, the light is dim though, which means that it doesn’t see the can

posts.name: Scott McRoberts
posts.cooked:
Many of the components of the FRC ® Control System have indicator lights that can be used to quickly diagnose problems with your robot. This guide shows each of the hardware components and describe...

Use these blink codes for cancoder troubleshooting. We had one that the magnet was to close so we used a small folded piece of paper as a shim in between the cancoder and the housing to get it the right distance.

link_counts.title: Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: the main problem is that it doesn’t connect to the can bus

posts.name: MetabolicCloth
posts.cooked: Do you potentially have two CANCoders assigned the same CAN ID? Sometimes that can make it appear like theres less devices on the bus.

posts.name: Bodi
posts.cooked: I second this. We have had typos and got our CAN ID’s mixed up before, which causes a similar issue to what’s being described here.

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: we did have that problem with the other three cancoders we used but this one doesn’t have the same problem

posts.name: Scott McRoberts
posts.cooked: Check the solder joints. Also that you don’t have the yellow and green wires mixed up.

posts.name: Bodi
posts.cooked: If you didn’t buy the pre-soldered CANcoders I would check to make sure the two yellow or green wires aren’t shorted on the PCB, and that they’re in the correct spots on the PCB.

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: i will check again but i’m pretty confident the wires are correct and are not shorted

posts.name: MetabolicCloth
posts.cooked: Are you able to isolate the single CANCoder, have that be the only device on your CAN bus and see if it still fails to come online

posts.name: Scott McRoberts
posts.cooked: What did you find that fixed the issue?

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: turns out someone (not naming names but it was me) had damaged the circuits in the pcb so our electrical mentor shorted a few wires together and then connected it to the cancoder and it works now

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.excerpt: We found it after hours and hours. One of our zipties was pulled too tight, it cut into the casing of the wire. After we replaced it everything worked fine again.

suggested_topics.title: Talonfx controller
suggested_topics.excerpt: If you are using a kraken or a falcon 500, they have built in motor controllers. if you are using something like neos then you need a sparkmax or the neo vortex motor controller.
